climbs.name: Tunnel of Love
climbs.fa: JBaker, BKristofitz, JWodraska, Don Vandegriff, Dec 2021

content.description: Best route at upper crag. Hardest and steepest. A touch longer than the others too. 2.5 stars and tickles 5.11-. Gives you something to think about all the way.
content.location: Just left of left side chimney. 2nd route from left overall. Starts from ledge with keeper bolt for the belayer.

content.description: Head-scratching start leads to more fun, delicate, off-vert climbing. Has some cool pockets.Named for Triple Trunked Tree at the base. Or TV Towers of Tucson.
content.location: 2nd route from right. Starts at Triple Trunked Tree.

content.description: Kind of a goofy little route that climbs better than it looks. A bit ledgey/bulgey so be careful when leading.Can easily be led on gear, which is what Josie did on the 2nd. Happy to chop the bolts if anyone cares.
content.location: Left of the lazy J crack. Climb up to a slopey ledge with a roof. Turn little roof on right side.

content.description: Really good off-vert face. A touch run at the top, but easy enough. Careful though. Cool features. Starts off a rocking... rock.One of those routes that climbs different each time I touch it.
content.location: Start off the rocking rock. 4th route from right.

content.description: A pure trad route. No bolts, no anchor. Lead, follow, walk off. Has a couple of actual jams for my fat hands.
content.location: As you move from the right side of the upper crag towards the center, you leave the trees and pop out on a platform. In front of you is a right-slanting weakness that obviously takes gear.

content.description: Really good. Can almost say 3 star in spite of being pretty short. Cool assortment of holds.
content.location: Just left of the rocking rock start of Rocka Rolla is a tiny arching roof. Hombre starts at the right edge of the roof and moves a bit left, then turns it and goes up. Quite a few underclings on the way.

content.description: Just good fun. Slightly less than vert. Start is cruxy. Another interesting crux to finish.
content.location: Right-most route on upper crag. Starts just left of a crack which can be used for a sidepull or 2 if you wish.

climbs.name: A Walk After Dark
climbs.fa: JBaker, Don Vandegriff, Josie Wodraska, Brian Kristofitz, Nov 2021

content.description: Big holds, then plates and a mantel. Then more plates and a weird mantelish crux. Steep-ish and tricky for a nine.
content.location: Far left side. Starts on the ledge. There is a keeper bolt on the ledge for the belayer.

content.description: More nice off-vert face-climbing. This route had a weird anchor at 3/4 height left by Adam Block (no... The other Adam Block). It was removed and bolt holes plugged.
content.location: 3rd route from right. Starts in front of big dead pine.

content.description: SE facing. 35 to 50 feet high. Kind of reminds me of Players Club but better and more interesting rock.A nice hang with trees shading the right side.Several of the right side routes can be TRed by rapping from Adam Block's old but solid-looking anchor on top of the crag to get to the mussys of the route you select.
